newsitem.title: USA: Wisconsin Energy in ash by-product contract.
newsitem.headline: Wisconsin Energy in ash by-product contract.

text.p: Wisconsin Energy Corp said Friday its Wisconsin Electric unit hired American Fly Ash to help market its ash by-products to other companies.

The utility said American Fly Ash will collect ash produced at its coal-burning power plants in southeastern Wisconsin, which currently has an ash utilization rate of 59 percent. The company believes this rate can be even higher.
Ash by-products can be used as an additive to concrete, as a sludge stabilizer and as a raw material for construction industry products, Wisconsin Electric said.
Wisconsin Energy is a utility holding company. Its shares were unchanged Friday at 27-3/8.
